fields.headline: Trump: I’m running a ‘fine-tuned machine’
fields.bodyText: In a vaudevillian, digressive, confident, disoriented, 77-minute news conference Thursday, Donald Trump touted his work as president, denied ties to Russia, attacked the media, claimed to be popular and obsessed over Hillary Clinton. Read all about it I turn on the TV, open the newspapers and I see stories of chaos, chaos. Yet it is the exact opposite. This administration is running like a fine-tuned machine, despite the fact that I can’t get my cabinet approved. – Donald Trump Trump branded reports that his presidential campaign had contacts with Russia before the election as “fake news”. He said he had “inherited a mess” and blamed the chaos set off by his travel ban on “a bad court”. “I’m not ranting and raving,” he said. ‘Russia is fake news’ Trump analysed why Russia and the United States should get along. “Don’t forget,” Trump said, “we’re a very powerful nuclear country and so are they. There’s no upside.” Trump announces new immigration order next week We’re a very powerful nuclear country and so are they. I have been briefed. And I can tell you one thing about a briefing that we’re allowed to say because anybody that ever read the most basic book can say it: nuclear holocaust would be like no other. – Donald Trump Trump said he fired former national security adviser Michael Flynn because Flynn had communicated poorly with the vice-president. But Trump said he didn’t mind Flynn discussing sanctions with Russia and said he would have approved. About that 2-state solution Trump asked April Ryan, an African American journalist, if she would set up a meeting for him with the Congressional Black Caucus to discuss his inner-city agenda: “Are they friends of yours?” “Least racist person” At the start of the press conference Trump announced a new labor secretary nomination: Alexander Acosta, a Hispanic law school dean who has staunchly defended the rights of Muslim Americans.
